text: Hi, when creating a custom module and adding fields to be used as a repeater group is there something other than copying the snippet from the group you need to make it editable? I keep getting “This module does not have any editable options.” :S
The fields have to have "prevent editing in the editor" disabled

Yes it functions the same. Tags used to be called topics but they found people coming from other platforms didnt realize they were basically the same thing so they renamed them from topics to tags, thus the old function is technically deprecated and tags is the correct one to use. I think for backward support they made the topics functions simply execute the tags functions to prevent things breaking
Hello all, someone who succeed to inject code in the <head> of a page using a custom module? I'm trying to create a selector to select if the page must be index etc.

well you would use javascript to do it something like `$("head").append(" YOUR META TAG HTML HERE")`
That said I don’t recommend using a custom module to do this, you would be relying on javascript to be running and timed right so the bot sees the metatag before it moves past the head
You could do this exact same thing by using a choice field inside of the head html area if you wanted though, and not need javascript
interesting, but i will need the module in the template as well in order for the use to select its option, right?
user*
no, you can put the hubl choice tag in the html head and it will still render up there
and show in the page editor
oh cool
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags#choice>
Nice, so I can set it up across all pages from the settings and the selection would be individually for each pages?

correct, and if you want to keep it inside a CM. You can add the call of the CM right on the head (actually I never tried to call a CM inside the head :thinking_face: but "should" work... let us know :D)
pretty sure it does work btw Gonzalo tried it like a couple months ago I think
al right thanks
I have an error when I'm creating my choices list.. I assume it is because my value is html (i.e. <meta name="robots" content="noindex, follow">) what is the proper encoding is supported by HubL?
I recommend put that out the select choice.

I mean, you can just have the content property value as the select options like:
noindex nofollow, noindex follow, index, follow...

then use like:
`<meta name="robots" content="{{ yourChoiceField }}">`
:sweat_smile:  lol sorry that was obvious

For the record when I past my module ({% module "module_1542219805551383" module_id="4301188" label="auxilio - Index Follow Selector for SEO" %}) right in the site header html it results in this error right away: "There is invalid HTML or HubL in the Head HTML"
interesting, thanks for check
my pleasure
<@U7SL518D6> <@U7ADCU3BM> Here is how I did it finally. Thanks guys for your help!
Question: I have a client with a GoToWebinar integration. Anyone know of a way to get the list of webinars with HubL. If even possible at all.
What do you try to do exactly? Display a list of upcoming webinars on a web page? or something like that?
